Material used.Material Source: Brain tissue from a patient with familial Parkinson's disease
Material used.Description: The study used brain tissue from a patient with the A53T mutation in the a-synuclein gene.

Readout description.Conclusion: Abnormal accumulation of insoluble filamentous a-syn protein
Readout description.Result Description: The study found abnormal accumulations of insoluble filamentous a-syn protein in brain tissue from the patient.

Biological replicates.Description: The study used multiple biological replicates to confirm the results.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type a-synuclein protein was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Not specified in the literature. Assuming standard statistical methods were used.

Approved assay.Reason: The experimental protocol used in the literature is not a standard or generally accepted method for studying Parkinson's disease.
